channel.title: express on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in express on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Getting Started with Typescript and Socket.Io - Tutorial
item.description: Last Updated - 24th December, 2018 Welcome friends! In this tutorial, we are going to be looking at how you can build a websocket based server using both TypeScript and Socket.io. We’ll be covering the following: What WebSockets are and why they are beneficial Building a Simple TypeScript WebSocket Server Building a Simple client to connect to our Server Two-way communication between our client and our server WebSockets WebSockets are an awesome technology and I absolutely love playing around with them and creating real-time applications.

item.title: Building a RESTful API using Express and Typescript
item.description: In this tutorial, we are going to be building a REST API using both express and TypeScript! This REST API will simply return a status depending on what API endpoint we hit using our HTTP Client. Prerequisites You will require at least the following: TypeScript 2.8.1 The Yarn Package Manager ExpressJS Our Project Layout So within our project, we are going to create a couple of incredibly simple endpoints that will simply return a few simple strings, depending on what HTTP verb is used to hit said route.
